Taitung County is located in the eastern part of Taiwan and is divided into city, urban townships, rural townships, and mountain indigenous townships. Taitung City serves as the county seat and is the political, economic, and cultural center of the county. The Taitung County Government and Taitung County Council are responsible for governing the county and making local administrative decisions. The county has a diverse population and is known for its beautiful coastline, including the scenic East Coast National Scenic Area and the Huatung Valley. Rao Ching-ling, a member of the Kuomintang, currently serves as the Magistrate of Taitung County.

The capital of Taitung County is Taitung City.
